title: cli-replay Scenario
description: Schema for cli-replay scenario YAML files. Defines the structure for recording and replaying CLI command interactions.

steps.description: Ordered list of command-response steps and optional step groups.
steps.markdownDescription: Ordered list of command-response steps and optional step groups.

meta.description: Scenario metadata including identification and template variables.
meta.markdownDescription: Scenario metadata including identification and template variables.

vars.description: Template variables for dynamic content substitution in stdout/stderr fields.
vars.markdownDescription: Template variables for dynamic content substitution in `stdout`/`stderr` fields. Use `{{.vars.key}}` syntax in response fields.

security.description: Security constraints on which commands may be intercepted.
security.markdownDescription: Security constraints on which commands may be intercepted.

allowed_commands.description: Allowlist of command names that may be intercepted. When set, only these commands will have shims created.
allowed_commands.markdownDescription: Allowlist of command names that may be intercepted. When set, only these commands will have shims created.

oneOf.description: A leaf step with match criteria and response.
A group of steps with unordered matching.

step.description: A single command-response pair. Matches an incoming CLI command and returns a canned response.
step.markdownDescription: A single command-response pair. Matches an incoming CLI command and returns a canned response.

when.description: Conditional expression. Step is only eligible when this evaluates to true.
when.markdownDescription: Conditional expression. Step is only eligible when this evaluates to `true`.

match.description: Criteria for identifying an incoming CLI command.
match.markdownDescription: Criteria for identifying an incoming CLI command.

argv.description: Command and arguments to match. First element is the command name, rest are arguments. Supports glob patterns.
argv.markdownDescription: Command and arguments to match. First element is the command name, rest are arguments. Supports glob patterns (e.g., `*`, `**`).

stdin.description: Expected stdin content. When set, the step only matches if stdin matches this value.
stdin.markdownDescription: Expected stdin content. When set, the step only matches if stdin matches this value.

respond.description: Response to return when the step is matched.
respond.markdownDescription: Response to return when the step is matched.

stdout.description: Inline stdout content. Mutually exclusive with stdout_file.
stdout.markdownDescription: Inline stdout content. Mutually exclusive with `stdout_file`.

stderr.description: Inline stderr content. Mutually exclusive with stderr_file.
stderr.markdownDescription: Inline stderr content. Mutually exclusive with `stderr_file`.

stdout_file.description: Path to file containing stdout content. Mutually exclusive with stdout.
stdout_file.markdownDescription: Path to file containing stdout content. Mutually exclusive with `stdout`.

stderr_file.description: Path to file containing stderr content. Mutually exclusive with stderr.
stderr_file.markdownDescription: Path to file containing stderr content. Mutually exclusive with `stderr`.

delay.description: Response delay in Go duration format (e.g., '100ms', '1s', '2.5s').
delay.markdownDescription: Response delay in Go duration format (e.g., `100ms`, `1s`, `2.5s`).

calls.description: Invocation bounds for this step. Defaults to {min: 1, max: 1} when omitted.
calls.markdownDescription: Invocation bounds for this step. Defaults to `{min: 1, max: 1}` when omitted.

min.description: Minimum number of times this step must be invoked. 0 means optional.
min.markdownDescription: Minimum number of times this step must be invoked. `0` means optional.

max.description: Maximum number of times this step may be invoked. Must be >= 1.
max.markdownDescription: Maximum number of times this step may be invoked. Must be `≥ 1`.

group_wrapper.description: A wrapper containing a step group with unordered matching semantics.
group_wrapper.markdownDescription: A wrapper containing a step group with unordered matching semantics.

step_group.description: A group of steps that can be matched in any order. All steps in the group must meet their minimum call bounds before the scenario advances past the group.
step_group.markdownDescription: A group of steps that can be matched in any order. All steps in the group must meet their minimum call bounds before the scenario advances past the group (barrier semantics).

mode.description: Matching mode. Currently only 'unordered' is supported.
mode.markdownDescription: Matching mode. Currently only `unordered` is supported.

name.description: Human-readable group name for labeling. Auto-generated as 'group-N' when omitted.
name.markdownDescription: Human-readable group name for labeling. Auto-generated as `group-N` (1-based) when omitted.

steps.description: Child steps in the group. Must contain at least one step. Nested groups are not allowed.
steps.markdownDescription: Child steps in the group. Must contain at least one step. Nested groups are **not** allowed.
